column9: Reviewed in the United States on April 21, 2020
column14: I totally invested into my car with this expensive $300 dash cam after getting into an accident where the other driver chased me across 5 lanes on I95 after I got in front of her in the HOV lane. She proceeded to throw objects at my car. We ended up colliding as I was trying to get off the ramp. She then began looking to see if I had a dash cam, after which she took pictures of my car, and tried to claim bodily injuries and say I hit her the next day.  Come find out she was driving someone else’s car, and doesn’t have insurance. The owner of the vehicle does.

column9: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2020
column14: After spending an hour properly installing the front and rear camera, I turned it on.  Within 5 mins, the front camera wire connection started smoking.  I pulled the front camera cord out, burning my fingertip in the process, and noticed the connecting spots were melting.  I'm returning the product for now, but am willing to give it another chance.  Amazon is sending a replacement.  For now, this gets 1 star = DANGEROUS.  I'll update this review after testing the replacement soon.

column9: Reviewed in the United States on June 21, 2020

column6: The best one I've ever used. Period.
column9: Reviewed in the United States on March 8, 2020
column14: I've had so many cameras that I lost track. My previous one was a Junsun and it was great but it died immediately as soon as the car turned off.
